intro: Premna angolensis var. cuneata, commonly known as the African nettle or African bittersweet, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and has opposite, ovate to elliptical leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters, followed by spherical, woody fruits that split open to release tiny seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks. The species is noted for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
